titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Augustus Jung (d. 1952) and G. Wendell Jung (1906-1999) were both Presbyterian ministers. G. Wendell Jung received his Master's in Theology from Princeton Theological Seminary in 1933. He served in churches in New York and New Jersey (including the Presbyterian Church at Woodbury, NJ from 1950 to 1963). From 1963 to 1969 he served as Field Director of Christian Education in the Synod of New Jersey. In 1969 he became Interim Executive of the Synod of New Jersey. He retired in 1972, but continued to serve part time as pastor in churches in Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographic portraits of August Jung and Wendell Jung and a photograph of August Jung at the pulpit in Karmel.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
